intro: Nothoscordum ipacarainum, commonly known as the ipacarai garlic. It is a flowering plant native to Brazil, belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. The plant produces strikingly large, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It has a bulbous base similar to garlic, which is used in traditional medicine by local communities. The plant thrives in tropical climates and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
